name: lean4
description: Lean 4 language support for VS Code

lean4.toolchainPath.markdownDescription: **DO NOT CHANGE** unless you know what you are doing. Path to your Lean toolchain. Leave this blank to get the default location from your PATH environment or from the default elan install location.

lean4.input.customTranslations.markdownDescription: Add additional input Unicode translations. Example: `{"foo": "☺"}` will correct `\foo` to `☺`.

lean4.input.languages.markdownDescription: Enable Lean Unicode input in other file types.

items.description: the name of a language, e.g. 'lean', 'lean4', 'markdown'

lean4.input.leader.markdownDescription: Leader key to trigger input mode.

lean4.input.eagerReplacementEnabled.markdownDescription: Enable eager replacement of abbreviations that uniquely identify a symbol.

lean4.automaticallyBuildDependencies.markdownDescription: Enable automatically building dependencies when opening a file. In Lean versions pre-4.2.0, dependencies are always built automatically regardless of this setting.

lean4.serverEnv.description: Environment variables to add to the Lean 4 server environment

lean4.serverEnvPaths.description: Paths to add to the Lean 4 server environment PATH variable.

items.description: a path to add to the environment

lean4.lakePath.markdownDescription: Path to Lake. Leave this blank to use the Lake from the toolchain.

lean4.serverArgs.description: Arguments to pass to the Lean 4 server.

items.description: an argument to pass to the server

lean4.serverLogging.path.description: Path to the directory where Lean 4 server log files are stored.

lean4.autofocusOutput.description: Automatically show the Output panel when the Lean 4 server prints a new message.

lean4.infoview.autoOpen.markdownDescription: Open infoview when Lean extension is activated for the first time.

lean4.infoview.autoOpenShowsGoal.markdownDescription: When auto-opened, the infoview shows goal and messages for the current line (instead of all messages for the whole file).

lean4.infoview.allErrorsOnLine.markdownDescription: Show all errors on the current line, instead of just the ones to the right of the cursor.

lean4.infoview.debounceTime.markdownDescription: How long (in milliseconds) the infoview waits before displaying new information after the cursor has stopped moving. The optimal value depends on your machine - try experimenting.

lean4.infoview.style.markdownDescription: Add an additional CSS snippet to the infoview.

lean4.infoview.showExpectedType.markdownDescription: Show the expected type by default.

lean4.infoview.showGoalNames.markdownDescription: Show goal names (e.g. `case inl`) in the infoview.

lean4.infoview.emphasizeFirstGoal.markdownDescription: Display goals other than the main goal in a smaller font size.

lean4.infoview.reverseTacticState.markdownDescription: Default to showing the goal type first and then the local context.

lean4.infoview.showTooltipOnHover.markdownDescription: Show the tooltip for an interactive element (e.g. a subexpression) when the pointer hovers over that element. When disabled, the element must be clicked for the tooltip to show up.

lean4.elaborationDelay.description: Time (in milliseconds) which must pass since latest edit until elaboration begins. Lower values may make editing feel faster at the cost of higher CPU usage.

lean4.showInvalidProjectWarnings.markdownDescription: Show warnings whenever a .lean-file is opened in a folder that does not contain a 'lean-toolchain' file.

lean4.alwaysShowTitleBarMenu.markdownDescription: Always display the Lean extension title bar menu in the top right. This helps beginners create and open Lean projects after launching an empty instance of VS Code, but may not be desirable for anyone who uses VS Code for things other than Lean.

commands.title: Server: Restart Server
commands.description: Restart the Lean server (for all files).

commands.title: Server: Stop Server
commands.description: Stop the Lean server (for all files).

commands.title: Server: Restart File
commands.description: Restarts the Lean server for the file that is currently focused, refreshing the dependencies.

commands.title: Server: Refresh File Dependencies
commands.description: Restarts the Lean server for the file that is currently focused to refresh the dependencies.

commands.title: Input: Convert Current Abbreviation
commands.description: Converts the current abbreviation (e.g. \lam).

commands.title: Infoview: Display Goal
commands.description: Display the goal and any messages at the current position in the infoview.

commands.title: Infoview: Toggle Infoview
commands.description: Toggle whether the infoview is displayed.

commands.title: Infoview: Toggle "All Messages"
commands.description: Toggles the "All Messages" panel in the infoview.

commands.title: Infoview: Copy Contents to Comment
commands.description: Copy the contents of the currently active tactic state panel to a new comment on the previous line.

commands.title: Infoview: Toggle Pin
commands.description: Create or remove a tactic state panel pinned to show the goal at the current position.

commands.title: Infoview: Toggle Updating
commands.description: Pause / Continue live updating of the main tactic state widget.

commands.title: Infoview: Toggle Expected Type
commands.description: Toggle the display of expected type.

commands.title: Docview: Show All Abbreviations
commands.description: Show help page containing all abbreviations and the Unicode characters they map to.

commands.title: Docview: Open Docview
commands.description: Open documentation found in local 'html' folder in a separate web view panel.

commands.title: Docview: Back
commands.description: Go to previous page in documentation view

commands.title: Docview: Forward
commands.description: Go to next page in documentation view

commands.title: Troubleshooting: Show Output
commands.description: Show output channel containing all progress updates and errors of commands

commands.title: Setup: Show Setup Guide
commands.description: Show 'Welcome' page containing a checklist of steps to install Lean 4

commands.title: Setup: Install Elan
commands.description: Install Lean's version manager 'Elan'

commands.title: Project: Create Standalone Project…
commands.description: Create a new Lean project that does not depend on any other projects

commands.title: Project: Create Mathlib Project…
commands.description: Create a new Lean math formalization project using Mathlib

commands.title: Project: Open Local Project…
commands.description: Opens a local Lean project

commands.title: Project: Download Project…
commands.description: Download an existing Lean project using `git clone`

commands.title: Project: Build Project
commands.description: Build the current project

commands.title: Project: Clean Project
commands.description: Clean the current project, removing all build artifacts

commands.title: Project: Update Dependency…
commands.description: Updates a dependency of the current project to the most recent version available for the branch pinned in 'lakefile.lean'.

commands.title: Project: Fetch Mathlib Build Cache
commands.description: Downloads cached Mathlib build artifacts to avoid full elaboration

walkthroughs.title: Lean 4 Setup
walkthroughs.description: Getting started with Lean 4 on Linux

steps.title: Re-Open Setup Guide
steps.description: This guide can always be re-opened by opening an empty file, clicking on the ∀-symbol in the top right and selecting 'Documentation…' > 'Setup: Show Setup Guide'.

media.altText: Click on the ∀-symbol in the top right and select 'Documentation…' > 'Setup: Show Setup Guide'.

steps.title: Books and Documentation
steps.description: Learn using Lean 4 with the resources on the right.

steps.title: Install Required Dependencies
steps.description: Install Git and curl using your package manager.

steps.title: Install Lean Version Manager
steps.description:
Install Lean's version manager Elan.
[Click to install](command:lean4.setup.installElan)

steps.title: Set Up Lean 4 Project
steps.description: Set up a Lean 4 project by clicking on one of the options on the right.

steps.title: Questions and Troubleshooting
steps.description: If you have any questions or are having trouble with any of the previous steps, please visit us on the [Lean Zulip chat](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/) so that we can help you.
